text.__SUMMARY__: Conus franklinae is a fossil species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails, cone shells or cones.
text.Description: The size of the shell attains 32.7 mm.
text.Distribution: This marine species of cone snail has only been found as a fossil in the Neogene of the Dominican Republic.
text.References: Hendricks J.R. (2015). Glowing seashells: diversity of fossilized coloration patterns on coral reef-associated cone snail (Gastropoda: Conidae) shells from the Neogene of the Dominican Republic. PLoS ONE. 10(4): e0120924
text.External links: To World Register of Marine Species
